greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n as x+y with 0<x<=y and x^2+3xy+y^2 prime.
comment: It is known that any prime p = 1 or -1 (mod 5) can be written uniquely in the form x(p)^2+3x(p)y(p)+y(p)^2 with x(p)>y(p)>0.
has the limit 1+sqrt(5) as N tends to the infinity.
These conjectures are similar to the ones mentioned in the comments in A218585.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures involving primes and quadratic forms, arXiv preprint arXiv:1211.1588, 2012.
example: For n=12 we have a(12)=1 since x^2+3x(12-x)+(12-x)^2 with 0<x<=6 is prime only when x=5.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Nov 03 2012
